ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned introductory Latin grammar skills, helping me to read basic Latin sentences, but I simultaneously gained a greater understanding of English grammar by studying the functions of direct objects, transitive and intransitive verbs, and prepositional phrases, just to name a few.
I learned how to study incrementally to establish the information for a longer period of time.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: The class is well taught and teaches you a lot of latin in just a semester. Weaknesses: The course moves fairly quickly to cover all of the material, thus sometimes some material is glossed over.

Introductory Latin is laid out incredibly well. The sequential order of how things are taught is incredibly well thought out, so things make a lot of sense and build upon each other well. Sometimes, however, studying grammar every morning for an hour gets repetitive and boring. Nevertheless, interaction and participation in this course is very high, so you stay engaged.
Honestly, this course was beautifully taught. I have no complaints whatsoever.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if they are interested in the language. This course is challenging but rewarding. If you want to learn latin, this course will help build you a solid foundation  for the language. If the student doesn't care much for latin and just wants and easy language requirement, they should look elsewhere. However, the course isn't too difficult, especially after making it passed the first few weeks. Daily quizzes make the student have to review material everyday, but the quizzes are always fair and helpful.

Yes, Latin is a straightforward and interesting language to help you fulfill your language requirement. On top of this, Latin is solely written - no oral examinations - and almost all graded translations are from Latin to English, making it easier than most other languages in which you have to be able to translate both ways.
Absolutely, Latin is a beautiful language, especially when taught by Daniel Graves.

extras.title: LATN 110 01 - The Elements of Latin Grammar
